channel.title: Comments on: Where did all the mammoths go?

item.title: By: gravelinspector-Aidan
item.dc:creator: gravelinspector-Aidan
item.description: <blockquote>Just for a bit of context, the last mammoths went extinct in Europe</blockquote>For certain values of "Europe" extending to (Googles ...) <a href="https://maps.google.com/maps?q=Russia,+Chukotka+Autonomous+Okrug,+Wrangel+Island&hl=en&ll=64.396938,118.300781&spn=40.658322,173.144531&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=35.273162,86.572266&oq=wrangel+island&hnear=Wrangel+Island&t=m&z=3" rel="nofollow">Wrangel Island</a>. That's within spitting distance of Alaska. (OK, it's closer to an Alaskan expectoration than to a British one. Or a Norwegian phleg, for that matter. Even from Kirkenes.)
item.content:encoded:
Just for a bit of context, the last mammoths went extinct in Europe

For certain values of “Europe” extending to (Googles …) Wrangel Island. That’s within spitting distance of Alaska. (OK, it’s closer to an Alaskan expectoration than to a British one. Or a Norwegian phleg, for that matter. Even from Kirkenes.)
